summary:

We have file-level metadata: file_path dvc/cachemgr.py. It manages caching operations, determining storage locations, initializing underlying storage backends, exposing a filesystem-based cache interface. Imports: GitFileSystem, Schemes, get_odb, DEFAULT_ALGORITHM, os, typing.Optional, TYPE_CHECKING. Globals: LEGACY_HASH_NAMES. Class CacheManager: manages caching operations, determining storage locations, initializing underlying storage backends, exposing a filesystem-based cache interface. Functions: _get_odb (no details), migrate_2_to_3 (no usage info). So summary: module provides CacheManager to handle data cache, decide where to store, initialize storage backends (like local, remote, git), and provide filesystem interface for cached objects. Business intent: support DVC's data version control system by abstracting cache handling, enabling efficient storage, retrieval, migration of cached data across versions and backends. Keywords: cache management, storage backend, filesystem interface, DVC, data versioning, migration, ODB, hash algorithm, legacy hash names.

Business intent: "Facilitates DVC's data version control by abstracting cache handling, ensuring efficient storage, retrieval, and migration of data artifacts across different storage schemes."
